data.title: Haan Mansion Museum (Lafayette)
data.meta_description: Haan Mansion Museum is a museum in Lafayette. View visitor information, information about the collection and read reviews.
data.text:
The Haan Mansion Museum of Indiana Art, located in Lafayette, Indiana, is a public museum that boasts the largest collection of Indiana art in the world. This extensive collection provides a comprehensive overview of the state's artistic heritage, making it a significant cultural destination for those interested in Indiana's art history.

Diverse Collection

The museum's collection is diverse and extensive, featuring over 100 paintings by the Hoosier Group and Indiana Regionalism artists. In addition to these paintings, the museum also houses a variety of ceramics, antique furniture, and decorative items. This wide range of exhibits offers visitors a comprehensive look at Indiana's artistic and cultural history.

Guided Tours and Events

The museum offers regular guided tours of its collection, providing visitors with in-depth insights into the artworks and their historical context. Additionally, guided nature walks are available, offering a chance to explore the museum's outdoor spaces. During the summer months, music concerts are held on the museum lawn, adding a lively dimension to the museum experience.
